From: Joseph Vaughan <jvaughan@...>

This is almost certainly a classpath problem. 

A few common pitfalls:

Be sure to set your classpath to include the junit.jar (not just the
directory which contains it, you must type out the .jar name as well).  e.g.
D:\myjars\ajar.jar

Be sure that your classpath does not overlap your package names.

ie. My classpath is D:\Openratings\source\java\
    my package name is com\openratings\junit\

The error your getting looks like your classpath is the equivelent of
D:\Openratings\source\java\com\openratings\junit\.

The classloader looks in the classpath + the package name.

Hope that helps.

 - joe


-----Original Message-----
From: Janise Hood [mailto:jhood@...]
Sent: Friday, May 11, 2001 3:50 PM
To: 'junit@yahoogroups.com'
Subject: [junit] Exception occurred during event Dispatching


I'm new to JUnit so bare with me.
Running in WinNT 4.0 environment
Installed JUnit 3.6
Already had JDK 1.3
Modified Classpath to add the junit.jar and other dirs

I can run the samples and the tests.  It's only when I try to run a test on
my own project that I rec'd the dreaded exception.

Exception occurred during event dispatching:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
SanDB/project/classes/com/connex/sanavigator/com
mon/TESTDIR/tests/PropertiesUtilTest (wrong name:
com/connex/sanavigator/common/
sanutil/TESTDIR/tests/PropertiesUtilTest)

Thanks in advance for any assistance.

Janise
